name: Flowerbomb Eau de Parfum with Vanilla, Jasmine, and Rose
about: Fragrance Family: Floral..Scent Type: Warm Floral..Key Notes: Vanilla, Jasmine, Orange Blossom..Fragrance Description: This floral perfume for women explodes with an intoxicating whirl of cattleya, jasmine, and rose. The warm scent of patchouli and vanilla grounds the fresh fragrance, adding a sensual twist on the scent reminiscent of a room filled with rose petals...About the Bottle: The instantly recognizable grenade fragrance bottle displays the soft-pink hue of the floral women's perfume within, contrasting the harsh shape with a distinctly feminine scent encapsulated within...About the Fragrance: This luxe feminine perfume is a veritable summer garden party in a bottle. Exploding with floral scents of rosebud and jasmine accented by a warm patchouli and vanilla cologne base, this perfume for women exudes classic femininity through warm floral fragrances...This fragrance is an Allure Best of Beauty award winner.
ingredients: Alcohol, Parfum/Fragrance, Aqua/Water, Benzyl Salicylate, Linalool, Butyl Methoxydibenzoylmethane, Ethylhexyl Methoxycinnamate, Limonene, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Coumarin, Benzyl Alcohol, Benzyl Benzoate, Citral, Ci 19140/Yellow 5, Ci 60730/Ext. Violet 2, Ci 17200/Red 33.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Fragrance is intensified by the warmth of your own body. Apply in the creases of your knees and elbows for a longer-lasting, stronger scent.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brunette hair, Porcelain skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I realize that perfume is highly personal.  I do not like this one, I'll be returning it.  I was hoping, based on the description that this might be a bit more floral and earthy due to the mentioned added notes of patchouli and warmer floral notes.  The perfume is sickly sweet to the point of being irritating.  I left it for an hour to see if it would settle and had to wash it off.  I  couldn't stand it. Most perfumes in the west have a smell that is the same between all of them and I believe it's in how they are manufactured.  They all have an overpowering kind of alcohol smell that never goes away.  I was hoping to smell all the floral notes mentioned but I really just smell too much sugar and that production carrier smell. I've purchased perfumes from the middle East before that do not have this production smell at all so I believe it's the way they are produced.  it's possible that I might just prefer sented oils and perfume in general is not the right choice for me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I had been wanting to purchase Flowerbomb for a long time, but I didn't want to invest in the big bottle if I didn't like it, so I got the travel size without even smelling it yet. I am blown away by this scent, it is so unique and vibrant without being too overpowering. The florals are so light and airy, almost as if walking in a garden with the faint smell of flowers. What really makes this perfume so special though is the base notes of vanilla and patchouli which really complement the florals to give it a lasting and comforting smell that lasts throughout the day. I can't stop smelling my wrists, I am so obsessed with it and I'll definitely be buying a bigger bottle when my travel size runs out. I'd say that this is your scent if you like a mix of florals and warm notes like musk and vanilla, because the two together is just breathtaking.
A Classic and a staple! A must-have in any perfume collection!

reviews.review_text: I've loved this fragrance since it first came out and have loved it ever since.  I've never grown tired of it, not even throughout all the hype surrounding it for quite awhile.  It's just such a warm, cozy, inviting scent, perfect for fall and winter, spring and even summer.  Love the slickness to it.  The floral is not overwhelming on me at all.  In fact, I don't even consider it a floral on me.  I don't think I'll ever grow tired of this scent.  Longevity is average, although even after I cannot smell it any longer on myself, I know others still can because I've gotten compliments.  I don't think anyone could ever go wrong with this classic fragrance.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm definitely not sophisticated when it comes to describing scents or detecting notes from fragrance. I just know whether or not I like it, and have a vague idea of why. This is great! I got it with my rewards points in a trial size; it comes in a dabber bottle, and I feel like I would prefer it as a spray. It's still wonderful, though.  When I inhale this, I get a weird warm, fuzzy, gentle comforted feeling, for some reason. I'm not sure exactly why, because I don't think it actually is familiar -- it just feels that way. It makes me feel warm and happy and relaxed. It's just a nice, gentle sweet, feminine fragrance that I love.  I have to give it 4 stars because I don't think I would place it in my top 3 and I reserve 5 star reviews only for the absolute best of the best, but this is definitely a solid 4.5; one of my favorites, and I will likely buy the full size once it's within my budget (i.e., a couple of months after the holidays lol).   In terms of longevity, I would rate this as average -- it lasts a few hours on me; it's neither super long lasting nor does it fade quickly. No complaints about it, but no praise for it either. I would love to try the body lotion with it to see if that helped it to last even longer.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin

It's such a lovely, warm, rich, cozy, inviting, comfy scent .. perfect for fall/winter but I also wear it year-round. reviews.review_text: Thanks to Influenster and Viktor and Rolf for this complimentary gift set in exchange for my honest review!  What do Emily Ratajowski and I have in common? Contrary to popular belief it is not that both of us count Harry Styles, Eric Andre, and Pete Davidson among our list of lovers.   We do, however, both smell like freesia, rose petals, and vanilla, because we both wear Flowerbomb!  The gift set itself was indicative of how I feel while wearing the scentu2014dainty, feminine, and luxurious. It was a bit on the lighter side, so I did find myself reapplying during the day, but I love the overall floral scent and how it changes as it sits on the skin. I also love using the body cream at night before I go to bed!   I look forward to continuing to use this throughout the spring, and getting compliments on how good I smell!

reviews.review_title: An explosion of dark sweet flowers
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Flowerbomb is exactly what the name says... an explosion of sweet, warm flower notes. Although there's tea and bergamot in the top notes, there's nothing fresh; it's like a bouquet of flowers in a dark velvet room, sitting there for days to dry in an intoxicating aroma. Usually I hate patchouli notes, but Flowerbomb is one of the few fragrances that makes it bearable to me (the patchouli and musk notes are the only reason I took one star out). The fragrances lasted quite long on my skin and clothes. It's a very sensual scent that I can easily wear during the day, not just for a night out.

reviews.review_text: I received a gift card to select a product of my choice to review and I chose FlowerBomb by Viktor & Rolf. I would describe it as sweet, sensual, seductive and feminine and perfect for date night or if youu2019re BOLD everyday wear. The bottle is beautiful and will definitely make a statement on your vanity. If youu2019re looking for a new scent I would choose the sweet feminine allure of FlowerBomb!

reviews.review_buyer_description: black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Scent is subjective. What you smell, I may not smell and vice versa. Also, body chemistry & skin moisture level plays a role in how frags smell on each individual. With that said, ON MY SKIN Flowerbomb smells like LVEB & Prada Candy had a baby. Itu2019s an overwhelmingly sweet powder frag with a hint of patch in there. I most detect vanilla, patch, musk, orange flower & EXTREMELY subtle hints of jasmine, osmanthus & freesia. Not very floral on my skin. Itu2019s a sugar bomb with a whisper of spice from the patch. Sillage is arms length that quickly settles to a skin scent. Longevity is right at 5 hours on me with well moisturized skin. It smells very similar to so many frags on the market so itu2019s not full bottle worthy & I would not repurchase. Itu2019s a safe blind buy. Basic, simple, subtle, inoffensive, crowd pleasing.
